## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{python}
from itertools import combinations
import pandas as pd
df=pd.read_csv("D:\\workflow_R\\wgcna_blue_mod_pathway\\path_gene_new.csv",nrows=5)
path_gene=df.set_index("pathway_name").T.to_dict('list')
list1=list(df["pathway_name"])

def path_val(x,y):
  val1=str(path_gene[x])[1:-1].strip("'")
  val2=str(path_gene[y])[1:-1].strip("'")
          
  return val1,val2
  
  
perm=combinations(list1,2)

temp=[]
list_id=[]
all=list(perm)
#for j in range(len(all)):
def path_generator(all,j):
  a1,a2=path_val(all[j][0],all[j][1])
  return a1,a2
  
m1,m2=path_generator(all,2)



#print(m1,m2)

```
